title: Rocket Lab wins government support to expand solar cell production
summary: Rocket Lab has lined up nearly $50 million in federal and state funding that will help the company expand a New Mexico factory where its produces space-grade solar cells.

title: Pentagon embracing SpaceX’s Starshield for future military satcom
summary: DoD buys Starlink’s commercial internet service but also plans to acquire more than 100 ‘Starshield’ satellites that would be government-owned

title: Kongsberg NanoAvionics strengthens government focus with new CEO
summary: Kongsberg NanoAvionics hopes to significantly expand its government business after appointing national security specialist Atle Wøllo to lead the Lithuanian small satellite builder.

title: Ars Live: How Profitable is Starlink? Join our discussion today!
summary: Eric Berger and Caleb Henry discuss the orbital ISP's economics at 2 pm Eastern.

title: As NASA watches Starship closely, here’s what the agency wants to see next
summary: "What happens if I don't have a Human Landing System available to execute a mission?"

title: Stoke Space ignites its ambitious main engine for the first time
summary: "This industry is going toward full reusability. To me, that is the inevitable end state."

title: Stoke Space test-fires new booster engine
summary: Stoke Space has test-fired a highly efficient engine it is developing for the first stage of its fully reusable launch vehicle.

title: Kepler demonstrates optical data relay service in LEO
summary: Kepler Communications has successfully tested optical inter-satellite links between a pair of data relay prototypes in low Earth orbit, the Canadian operator announced June 11.

title: China selects new batch of astronauts with an eye on the moon
summary: China’s human spaceflight agency announced the selection of 10 new astronauts Tuesday, aiming to bolster its spaceflight capabilities for future missions, including potential crewed lunar landings.
